pageDescription: In this guide you'll learn how to configure and customize your HUD and Interface Editor to optimize your gameplay.

preferences.title: Preferences
preferences.text1: By pressing <key>Ctrl+P</key>, you should open the <hl>Preferences</hl> menu.
preferences.text2: Enable <hl>Auto Loot Right-Click</hl>, enable <hl>Area Loot</hl>, and set <hl>Camera Distance to 100%</hl>.
preferences.text3: Enable <hl>Show Next Target in Cycle</hl> in the Combat tab.

combatLogging.title: Combat Logging
combatLogging.text1: In the Combat Logging tab, enable <hl>Enable Combat Logging to File</hl>.
combatLogging.text2: This is important for <hl>StarParse</hl>, an external DPS/HPS analysis tool.

subtitles.title: Subtitles & Alignment
subtitles.text1: Enable <hl>Subtitles</hl> and <hl>Alignment Gain</hl> to see Light/Dark points during conversations.

tooltips.title: Tooltips
tooltips.text1: In Tooltip settings, enable <hl>Show Detailed Item Tooltips</hl> to see complete item information.

crucialSettings.title: Crucial Settings
crucialSettings.text1: This is certainly the most important configuration:
crucialSettings.text2: Enable <hl>Use Operation Frames as Group Frames</hl>.
crucialSettings.text3: Turn on <hl>Cooldown Text</hl>, set <hl>Cooldown Style</hl> to Style 3, and <hl>Global Cooldown Style</hl> to Style 2.
crucialSettings.text4: Set <hl>Show Tenths of a Second</hl> to 1.

interfaceEditor.title: Interface Editor
interfaceEditor.text1: Press <key>ESC</key> and in the menu click on <hl>Interface Editor</hl>.
interfaceEditor.text2: The <hl>"Middle Box"</hl> configures all screen elements after you click on them.
interfaceEditor.text3: The color represents the interface status: <green>green</green> = active, <hl>red</hl> = disabled, and yellow = selected.

operationFrame.title: Operation Frame
operationFrame.text1: The first thing you should modify is your <hl>Operation Frame</hl>. Feel free to modify the configuration.
operationFrame.text2: The Operation Frame is responsible for showing group players. It also contains information like <hl>buffs and debuffs</hl> of the group, which can be important for signaling a raid.

targetFrame.title: Target Frame
targetFrame.text1: The <hl>Target Frame</hl> is where the information of everything you select will appear: Enemy, NPC, etc.
targetFrame.text2: It contains all enemy information, including: <hl>Health, Buffs, and Debuffs</hl>.
targetFrame.text3: You can configure it so that your debuffs appear highlighted on the Boss, so you don't confuse them with other players' debuffs.
targetFrame.text4: You can also categorize buffs and debuffs to appear by application order or by <hl>time remaining</hl>.

targetOfTarget.title: Target of Target
targetOfTarget.text1: Enable <hl>Target of Target</hl> in your interface. It's used to know who your target is looking at.
targetOfTarget.text2: Very useful for <hl>tanks</hl> to know if they have aggro.

focusTarget.title: Focus Target
focusTarget.text1: Used to create a second target for what is selected. Activate using <key>Alt+F</key>.
focusTarget.text2: Can be used in fights where you need to watch the boss's health while hitting something else.
focusTarget.text3: You can also acquire the Focus Target's target using <key>Ctrl+F</key> (Acquired Focus Target).

debuffTray.title: Player Debuff Tray
debuffTray.text1: Shows the <hl>Debuffs</hl> (negative effects) that the enemy placed on you, which may or may not be cleansable.
debuffTray.text2: It's very important to <hl>increase the debuff scale</hl> and keep it visible. Usually it comes too close to buffs — the tip is to keep them slightly apart.

buffTray.title: Player Buff Tray
buffTray.text1: Shows your class <hl>Buffs</hl>, Stims, and others (positive effects). Different from debuffs.

systemMessages.title: System Messages
systemMessages.text1: You may not give much importance to system messages, but <hl>the bigger the size, the better</hl>.
systemMessages.text2: It can indicate a <hl>boss mechanic about to execute</hl>. It's important to pay attention to what's announced — depending on your awareness, it can cause an unwanted death.
systemMessages.text3: In the example below, <hl>Ciphas</hl> (Dread Guards - TFB) places a curse on the player "Belraijin", which after a few seconds will lead to death if the fight mechanic isn't executed.

quickbars.title: Quickbars
quickbars.text1: Quickbars can be edited however you prefer.
quickbars.text2: When starting the game, you use <hl>2 to 3 quickbars</hl>. As you progress, you'll start using <hl>4 to 6 quickbars</hl>, depending on how many skills your class has.

presetInterfaces.title: Ready-to-Use Interfaces
presetInterfaces.text1: If you need a ready-to-use interface, I'm sharing three that I use often. All come pre-configured and ready to go.
presetInterfaces.text2: Since the file doesn't have a digital signature, it may flag as a virus. In that case, just click <hl>"Keep"</hl> and run the installer. It will install all 3 interfaces. If you want to remove any, just open the Interface Editor and delete it.
